title: Torah (JPSA) 03: Leviticus
description:
The third book of the Pentateuch - Leviticus. Presented according to weekly parshah.
Praised are You, Adonai, Our G-d, ruler of the Universe, who has made us holy with commandments and commanded us to engage in the study of Torah. (Traditional prayer).
- Summary by Linette Geisel. Parshat descriptions provided by Wikipedia

sections.title: Parshat Vayikra - Leviticus 1:1 – 5:26 Laws of the sacrifices
Parshat Tzav – Leviticus 6:1 – 8:36 Sacrifices, ordination of the priests
Parshat Shemini – Leviticus 9:1 – 11:47 Tabernacle consecrated, alien fire, dietary laws
Parshat Tazria – Leviticus 12:1 – 13:59 Childbirth, skin disease, clothing
Parshat Metzora – Leviticus 14:1 – 15:33 Skin disease, infected houses, genital discharges
Parshat Acharei Mot – Leviticus 16:1 – 18:30 Yom Kippur, centralized offerings, sexual practices
Parshat Kedoshim – Leviticus 19:1 – 20:27 Holiness, penalties for transgressions
Parshat Emor – Leviticus 21:1 – 24:23 Rules for priests, holy days, lights and bread, a blasphemer
Parshat Behar – Leviticus 25:1 – 26:2 Sabbatical year, debt servitude limited
Parshat Bechukotai – Leviticus 26:3 – 27:34 Blessings and curses, payment of vows
